33223.name: Santa Claus Takes the Intercity
33223.description:
A simple game of bidding for 25 intercity railway routes on a map of the Netherlands, self-published and sent to Han Heidema's gaming contacts as a Christmas gift in 1997.

Players needed to supply their own crayons or felt pens for colouring routes on the map, and each player needs a suit of 13 cards from a standard card deck.

Each turn, one card from a deck of 25 route cards is revealed. Players bid to win the route by each simultaneously playing a card from their hands. Highest untied card wins the route. The highest cards, winning cards, court cards and low cards (whose definition varies depending on number of players) are discarded after each bid. As each route is won it is coloured on the map to show its ownership, a la crayon rail games.

Each route is worth between 1 and 5 distance points. The winner is the player with the longest continuous route on the map when the 25 routes have all been won (or when all players are out of cards).

Simple but fun. The blue cardstock of the laminated map is the only downside, as it makes darker pen colours hard to differentiate.

33224.description: Matka Karjalaan (Journey to Karelia) is a slightly educational roll and move game. Players are dealt destination cards for cities in Karelia they have to visit. During the game they complete tasks in cities. Tasks are related to Karelian history and tradition. The game includes also chance cards that may send players to another city, or give them tasks similar to those appearing in cities. First player to visit all his destination cities and return is the winner.
33224.name: Matka Karjalaan

33225.name: Clue:  The Twilight Zone – Tower of Terror
33225.description:
The Twilight Zone Tower of Terror Clue is the second tin boxed Disney Theme Park Editions based on Clue. They are only sold at Disney resorts and theme parks.

Unlike its Haunted Mansion predecessor, this one re-designs the rooms with fewer mansion doors and a new story line based on The Twilight Zone Tower of Terror theme park ride.

While filming a movie, lightning strikes the building and one of the cast/crew disappears. Your goal is to figure out who is missing, with which movie prop and what room they disappeared from.

33226.name: 101 Dalmatians: Spin for Spots
33226.description:
The puppies have lost their spots. Help get them back!

Our playful puppies need their spots! Spin the spinner to be the first to put all the spots back on your puppy!

For 2 to 4 players, Ages 3 and up.

Game Contents: 4 Stand-Up Puppy Playing Pieces With Cardboard Bases, Eight Plastic Assembly Stands For Cardboard Bases, Reusable Puppy Spots, Spinner, And Instructions.

33227.name: Hoe overleef ik mezelf spel
33227.description: A trivia cardgame around the books by Dutch author Francine Oomen in which the players learn a lot about themselves and each other. Some acting skills, a bit of courage and lots of humour are required to play the game.

33228.name: Het Hoe Overleef Ik: Spel
33228.description:
A boardgame themed around Dutch author Francine Oomen's books.

Each players gets 4 pawns in one color. The players places the walls on the board on the spaces marked with a star. These walls block their way. The cards with questions and instructions in 3 different catergories are placed next to the board
Each turn a player throws the die and can move either direction, but only one direction each turn and only one pawn. When a player throws a 6, that player has an extra turn. A player can pass another pawns, but not pass the walls.
To remove a wall, a player has to land exactly on the space where wall stands. Than another player draws a card and choses a question or an instruction. If the player answers the question correctly or fullfilled the assignment, the wall is removed and placed elsewhre on the board.
The player who finishes exactly with one of his/her pawns on the destination field wins the game.

33229.name: In Your Face!
33229.description:
The object of In Your Face! is to get rid of all your cards before the other players do. Play the same color or number on the discard pile, or play Wild Cards. The game is played to an agreed upon score. The player with the fewest points at the end of the game is the winner.

When a player plays a wild card and tells you to draw a card, three cards, or lose a turn, if you have an IN YOUR FACE card you can play it and that player has to do what he/she told you to do, unless that player plays another IN YOUR FACE card, then you must draw or lose a turn.

33230.name: Nordopoly
33230.description: Nordopoly is yet another Monopoly clone. The game is a promotional item for Nordstrom department stores with squares and cards representing areas of the store such as Jewelry, Shoes, Sportswear, and Furnishings. The Jail Square is replaced with "Customer Service." Apparently, serving customers is equivalent to serving time.

33231.name: Quartette
33231.description:
Setup:
Alternate light and dark men on each of the back rows. Back rows will have 4 men each. Also the light and dark men will oppose each other across the board. (See picture)

Movement:
Players alternate moving by moving one man one square either horizontally or vertically. Diagonal movement is not permitted.

Goal:
To move your 4 men into a line either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

Equipment

Rule sheet on dark red paper
4 dark men, 4 light men
4x4 grid gameboard with checkerboard coloring

33232.description:
From the Box:

Four beetles have a funny race all over the country. The coloured dice determines which of them can move, the number dice determines how far the journey goes each time. Who's first to the sunflower?

Overview:

A simple little game that can be played with any child that knows how to count up to three, and can tell their colors. Whoever moves a beetle to the sunflower gets to keep that beetle. The person with the most beetles at the end of the game wins.

Content:

1 long game plan made from cardboard pieces, 4 wooden beetles in four colours, 1 coloured dice, 1 dice with number spots and game instructions.
33232.name: Krabbel, kleiner Käfer!

33233.name: Tortoise vs. Hare
33233.description: A Print-and-Play Miniature War-game Based on the ever growing conflict between the Tortoise and Hare Empires

33234.name: IceSickle
33234.description:
A single stash Icehouse game for two players.

Alternate turns placing pieces onto empty squares. Then take turns jumping a piece, diagonally or orthogonally, over at least one other piece into an empty square. Each piece can jump over its pip-count in squares. Remove the jumped pieces, and score their pips. Continue until no jumps remain.

33235.name: PFC: The Pro Football Chronology
33235.description:
Features:
All professional teams from the year 1920-2006 are included. (APFB, AFL & NFL)
Teams are rated in overall offense, defensive and execution ("X" factor, which is based on win percentage.) Teams are also assigned a power (P) rating, which fine-tunes a squad's offensive strength.
Fast and accurate results: Play a complete game in 5 to 10 minutes.
As in the high school game, the game engine is self-driven. You may still call for the 2-point conversion, run out the clock, attempt a 4th down conversion, use the hurry-up offense, and attempt onside kicks.
100 pre-printed action cards included, or you may use your own 10-sided dice or pre-printed random number sheets. (#'s 1-100)
Keep score and track the time expired as you play. Tally each team's cumulative plays and total yardage, if you wish to accumulate stats.

33236.name: Regional: The Game of Pro Bowling
33236.description:
Features:
All bowlers who competed in at least 3 rounds during the 2006 season are included
Non-PBA member bowlers also included
Optional lane condition system - May affect a bowlers final or individual frame score
2 ways to play: Quick mode or Ball-by-Ball; simulate an entire tournament quickly or watch the action unfold as it happens
Run your own regional tournaments; bowler charts are grouped by his or her home state

33237.name: Indulto: The Game of Bullfighting
33237.description:
Features:
The top 50 matadors of 2006 rated in every category
Large list of bulls, including weight & color. Bulls' behavior may lead to matador injuries.
63 of the world's top bull rings rated; the crowds play a part in the outcome
Fast action card driven; the matador performs the appropriate action for each tercio
Both matador and bull influence the action; a skilled matador will be awarded more trophies than those of inferior skill

33238.name: Friday Night: The Game of High School Football
33238.description:
Features:
All high school (and prep) football teams in each of the 50 states is included.
Teams are rated in overall offense, defensive and execution ("X" factor, which is based on win percentage.)
Quick playing: Play a complete game in 5 to 10 minutes.
Although most of the game engine is self-driven, there are a number of events which allow user decisions to influence the outcome: Go for the 2-point conversion, run out the clock, go for a 4th down conversion, conduct the hurry-up offense, and attempt the onside kick.
100 action cards included, or use your own dice/pre-printed random number sheets. (#'s 1-100)
Keep score and time expired as you play. Track each team's cumulative plays and total yardage.

33239.name: Trivial Pursuit: Chocolate Edition
33239.description: Trivial Pursuit - Chocolate Edition is a very simple implementation of the traditional Trivial Pursuit game. The game proceeds in turns taken in clockwise order. On your turn, the player to your right will ask you the questions. The question cards in this case are actually chocolate bites in paper wrap (on which the questions are written). The player who knows the answer to both questions on one card / bite gets it (and presumably digests it, as well). If an answer was wrong, the card is returned into the box. The player with the most correct answers in the end of the game is the winner, and is awarded the golden prize (which is made of chocolate, of course).

33240.name: Games of the Pilgrim's Progress, Going to Sunday School and Tower of Babel
33240.description:
An integrated three game set produced by McLoughlin Brothers, in true bookcase style. The wooden playing board has a pair of book-like spines on one side and the illusion of book pages on the others, with an outer slip case to hold everything together. The set also contains a dual arrowed spinning indicator which its makers proclaimed as "A Complete and Unobjectional Substitute for, and Improvement on Dice, Teetotums, &c."

In the basic Pilgrim's Progress game, played on the outer board halves, a player must move both of his pieces (two pawns: a Pilgrim and a Staff) by the number of spaces indicated by the dual spinner until he reaches the Giant Despair space. He then moves his Pilgrim alone until it lands by exact count on the Golden Gate, and thence (if not displaced) to victory in the Celestial City. Rules for three other variants are also included. These use various combinations of board spaces and require differing numbers of pieces.

In Going to Sunday School, played in one of the inner board halves, players spin and move around the board. Essentially, the player that lands on the most picture spaces (10 special spaces, each illustrating a virtue or a vice) is the winner.

The Tower of Babel, played in the other inner board half, combines a race for the top of the tower with a race to the bottom. Different rules apply to each race within the game. The winners of each half have a spin-off to determine the overall winner.

Contents:

Rule booklet
12 round-headed (Pilgrim) wood pawns
6 pointed-headed (Staff) wood pawns
Dual arrowed spinner
Wooden game board
Slip case

33241.name: Evel Knievel Stunt Game
33241.description:
"Evel Knievel races around the Track. You perform 6 Daredevil stunts. Most skillful cyclist wins."

A battery operated board game based on the exploits of the motorcycle riding, car jumping daredevil. The stunt motorcycle moves around a circular track and a "brake" button on the center motor allows the players to start and stop the motorcycle once a stunt has been set up. The six daredevil stunts the players perform are: Big Wheel (dodge the rolling tire), Barrel Barricade (stop before hitting the barrels), Wheelie, Stop on Ramp, Loop, and Pit Stop.

Components: Box, instructions, Evel Knievel cycle with wire, power pack, 2 barrels, 1 wheel ramp, 1 jump ramp, 1 incline, 1 wheel, and trophies. One D battery required.

33244.name: ONS.5: Outward North Atlantic Slow Convoy Five (1943)
33244.description:
This solitaire game depicts the struggle between Allied convoy ONS.5 and a large number of German U-boats in May 1943. This struggle is considered a turning point in the Battle of Atlantic.

The player tries to sink as many merchant ships as possible, the game system (rules and charts) governs the actions of the escort vessels.

Sequence of play (as taken from the rulebook):
Unit Availability Phase, Weather Phase, Convoy and Escort Movement Phase, U-boat Movement Phase, Search Phase, Combat Phase, Turn Record Phase

The game is available at http://www.kcl.ac.uk/schools/sspp/ws/consim.html

33245.name: Star Hopper
33245.description:
In this space-themed race game, you control 4 spaceships which you send out into the galaxy. At random intervals, your home government approves colonization of various star systems, and the first starship there gets exclusive rights to colonize. The first player with 4 colonies wins the game.

The star card deck show rough graphic representations and the actual names of the 40 closest star systems to our own, the next furthest out that we know or suspect might have planets, and other stars yet further out known for their place in constellations. The rule book gives more details about each of the 107 star systems and general facts about astronomy and astrophysics.

Contains: 1 game board, 108 card deck, 6 six-colored six-sided dice, 24 colored spaceship pawns, 48 translucent colony marker chips, rule book

33246.name: Master Spy
33246.description:
In this fast-paced strategy and memory update of Battleship, you have been hired to manage 5 spies, which you deploy secretly (represented by pegs on a pegboard grid). Every turn you move your spies hoping to encounter enemy spies based on intelligence gathered from your opponents. The only random element is that each player rolls a die at the end of a turn, which may result in nothing happening, or in a few cases the retiring of one of their spies, the recruiting of a new spy, or their defection (all players trade their pegboards to the left) and a new set of spies to direct.

Contains: 4 pegboard trays, 16 terrain sheets, 240 colored pegs, 1 six-sided die, 4 peg cups (for captured spies), rules

Expansion trays will be available to accommodate up to 6 players.

33247.name: Samsara
33247.description: In this multi-player chess-like game, each player has 5 stackable follower pawns that start out along the edges of a wheel-shaped board. Pawns become stronger by winning battles with superior forces, dividing 4 moves between their pawns on each turn. Whoever controls the most pawns when the first player is wiped out is the winner. Players may negotiate deals and form alliances.

33248.name: På nya äventyr med Pippi Långstrump
33248.description:
On new adventures with Pippi Longstocking.

Try to catch up with Pippi and her monkey Herr Nilsson on their adventures. If you are lucky to be in the same spot as Pippi you will receive 1 gold coin. The first who has 6 gold coins will win this game.

Childrens game Ages 6 and up.

Contents:

1 board game
1 dice
1 Pippi marker
1 Herr Nilsson marker
5 playing counter
30 gold coins.

33249.name: På nya hyss med Emil i Lönneberga
33249.description:
This is a game that is based on novel-writer Astrid Lindgren's most popular stories.

The game will take you on a journey on mischief, so hurry up, the one who will do the most mischief will win this game!!

Childrens game Ages 5 and up.

Contents:
1 Game board
1 dice
5 playing counter
8 card with Emil-mischief
1 Emil Card

33250.name: ZombieTown 2: Road Rage
33250.description:
Zombietown 2 adds cars and hidden agendas to the mix of the ZombieTown universe.

Cars and keys are distributed one per household at random. Players must find a matching key to use the car. Once the cars are in play they can be used to move quicker, run down zombies, or serve as makeshift barricades.

Hidden agendas are cards similar in size to the existing cards for the game. Each agenda has two possible conditions worth additional victory points. Players must choose one of them and reveal it when the conditions are met. If the conditions are later lost, the player retains his VP. The agendas on a card are related, so one might offer 5 points for having homes on two sides of the board and 10 for having homes on three sides.

Publisher's Page: http://www.twilightcreationsinc.com/zombietown/zombietown2.p...

Expands

ZombieTown

33251.name: Top Me
33251.description: Each player controls six cone-shaped "tops". During their turn, players roll two six-sided dice and move one of their tops around the board forward or backward. The object of the game is to capture all of your opponent's tops by landing on them before your opponents do. Before the captures are complete, you can unload your captors into your home space. The rules permit some areas on the board designated as safe zones and the option to trade captors with another player.

33252.description:
Tooth and Claw is a set of wargaming rules for hunters of prehistoric animals. One or more players can represent either stone age tribesmen or 19th Century sportsmen hunting after the biggest prey to roam the earth since the last Ice Age.

Weapon tables provide stats for pre-gunpowder weapons, muzzle-loading firearms, breech-loading rifles, and repeating guns.

Animal appearances are determined by encounter tables and their behavior, including attacks, are determined by the game system.

Animal stats include all the saber-tooth cats, prehistoric wolves and bears, mammoths, brontotheriums (rhinos), aurochs (oxen), giganthopithecus (gorillas), and giant birds.

There are 5 scenarios included in this 32 page full colour, self contained booklet.
33252.name: Tooth and Claw

33253.name: Wuzzles
33253.description:
Those delightfully mixed-up creatures, the Wuzzles, and their enchanted island of Wuz are just a wish away when you play this race game with the towering 3-D mountain.

The Wuzzles have been invited to a party, but unfortunately, their gifts have become as mixed up as the Wuzzles. Bits and pieces of their presents have been scattered all over the gameboard.

Can you tunnel in and out of the 3-D mountain, put together a complete gift, avoid Croc and the Creepasaurs, and be the first to arrive at the party?

33254.name: BSO FOOTBALL
33254.description:
BSO FOOTBALL
THE HISTORY OF PRO FOOTBALL

For fans of Tabletop Sports games, and Football, here is one of, if not THE, best solitaire play football card/board game ever. BSO FOOTBALL provides its players with remarkable statistical accuracy in almost every category, in the most accessible, playable form in the game industry. There’s no trying to outguess yourself on offense or defense. You just call the play and roll the dice (which you provide). Player Cards, one for every offensive player on the team, the Defensive Ratings on the Team Charts, and the Results Tables do the rest.

Check the sample Player Cards, above, to see how players are rated.

The Team Charts provide the ratings/information for Defense, Interceptions, Clutch Play, Fumbles, Penalties, and the full range of Returns and Kicking details. They also have Extra Information on Special and Unusual plays that team used. The Charts include Rushing, Pass Completion, Pass Gain and Return, Out-of-Bounds, Medium and Long Gains, Kickoff (including Onside Kicks), Punting (including Blocked Kicks), and a full range of Penalties.

The Game Clock is also extremely accurate, with each quarter using 180 “points”, each point equal to 5 seconds. A normal play would use 8 points, but an incomplete pass or Time Out only 1.

The first edition of BSO FOOTBALL brings you one of the greatest seasons in the History of Football, 1958, with the famous overtime Championship game between the Colts and the Giants. In the East the Giants and the Cleveland Browns, led by the great Jim Brown, had to use a playoff game to determine the winner, and the Steelers, led by the veteran Bobby Layne, were not that far behind. In the West, the Colts beat out both the Bears and Rams by one game.

Some of Pro Football’s greats are present: Ollie Matson, Norm Van Brocklin, Johnny Unitas, Jon Arnett, Y. A. Tittle, and the first glimpses of Bart Starr, Jim Taylor, and Paul Hornung, all playing for one of the worst Green Bay teams ever (1-10-1)! And wait’ll you see the average yards per pass catch! Steeler rookie, Jimmy Orr, led the league with 27.6, with many others not far behind.

For gamers who like to play entire seasons and revel in great statistical accuracy, BSO FOOTBALL is unbeatable. And, if you wish, there are special rules for face-to-face play, which use extended play calling (although, to be up front, that is not the game’s strong point).

player cards: 150
team cards” 12
others: Charts, Schedules, Rules
cost: $14 US; $15 Canada; $17 Pacific

33256.name: Safety First
33256.description:
Safety First: The Fun and Factual Game for Kids and Parents

This is a safety game for kids about how to stay safe when they're alone or in a difficult situation. The figures move around the board reaching places that represent school, the bus, home, the mall and other places a child might be. Children are asked questions about hypothetical situations - some social, some life-threatening - and asked to tell what they would do. Adult cards ask parents to answer questions about their own childhoods. When children are empowered by correct responses and adult reinforcement, their lives will be safer. Discussing these issues can help a kid to act smart, not scared if they find themselves in certain circumstances.

33257.description:
Folio is an Icehouse-based abstract strategy game for two players. The rules are simple, but the strategy can get mind-bending. It owes some rule ideas to the commercially available game Quarto (thus the name).

To play you require one stack of pyramids from each of four colours plus one extra from each colour (with only two of these being of the same size). You also need a chessboard or similar 8x8 grid.
33257.name: Folio

33258.name: Flix
33258.description:
Flix was distributed as a single game containing three rule variants (Lucky Flix, Pay-Off Flix, and Tac-T-Flix). The basic goal is to get 4 men in a row on a three dimensional gameboard. Specialized dice are used to limit the color and placement of pieces on the "Spaceboard". In Tac-T-Flix, Burocrats, a second type of game piece, are introduced.

Also see:
Qubic which is 4x4x4 tic-tac-toe

33259.description:
Starmada is a board game of starship combat. At its most basic level, players take command of space fleets in a general attempt to reduce each other to just so much space junk. At its most advanced, the game can be customized to breathe life into any science fiction background that players might imagine.

Novices shouldn’t fret; the core set of rules has been designed with simplicity and ease of play in mind, accessible even to beginners. On the other hand, seasoned veterans should find the concise nature of the rules quite refreshing. It allows players to concentrate on the finer points of squashing their opponents rather than arguing about rules interpretations, without sacrificing any of the flavor or excitement of more complex games.

Simple, but not simplistic, is the guiding principle.

The Admiralty Edition represents the latest incarnation of the Universal Game of Starship Combat. Included in the 80-page Core Rulebook:


The "essential" Starmada rules, including a new inertia-based movement system.



Over 80 different options from which players may pick and choose to create the perfect game.



A fully-customizable weapon design system, with almost five million different combinations.



A complete set of rules for fighters, allowing for nearly half a million different types of small craft.



A comprehensive construction system, allowing players to design their own starships with which to do battle.


In addition to the core rulebook and 48-page Starmada Universe guide, a number of different settings are planned for the near future, including collaborations with several other companies.

Available both in Print and PDF print-n-Play.

Expanded by:

Imperial Starmada Sourcebook
Starmada: Dreadnoughts
Starmada: Hammer and Claw
Starmada: Iron Stars
Starmada: The Admiralty Edition – Rules Annex




Integrates with:

Klingon Armada
Romulan Armada




Later editions:

Starmada Nova Rulebook
33259.name: Starmada: The Admiralty Edition

33260.name: Duel in the Sky
33260.description:
From the Box:

"They shall mount up with wings as eagles" (Isaiah 40:31)...and Duel in the Sky

This is a game of daring, strategy and chance. Two eagles circle, stalk and pursue each other until one swoops to victory.

To hover, to dive, to climb, to soar is decided by chance and the cast of a die. Direction and distance is decided by the strategy and daring of the player.

This is a 3-dimensional game that teaches in the simplest way: depth perception over a 2-dimensional playing surface.

Contents:

A large playing surface (cloth board), a die, and two cube playing pieces.

33261.description:
Second expansion for Thurn and Taxis - actually, 2 expansions in one.

"All roads lead to Rome"

1st expansion, "Audience": The players (clerics) try to arrive at the right time to be received in audience by the pope.

2nd expansion, "Offices of Honor": The postal staff still helps you - but now you can draw additional city cards, get victory points or even set a new house.

Expands:

Thurn and Taxis




Contents:

1 game board with various roads to Rome
5 carriages in the colors of the countries (beige – Baiern; orange – Böhmen/Salzburg; etc.)
26 office tiles
20 audience tiles with 5 different clerymen in the four player colors
4 summary tiles
12 victory point chips
33261.name: Thurn and Taxis: All Roads Lead to Rome

33262.description:
Wargame that was included in TSR Games Magazine "Little Wars" in the early 1980's. This is an armor and tank game using TSR's standard wargame rules.

Expanded by:

Close and Destroy II
33262.name: Close and Destroy

33263.name: Town And Country
33263.description:
Many stories can be told and many adventures await in this clever sequencing game for young children.

As card after card is placed in a row, story pictures are created to talk about and share. Players complete country or town scenes by matching the pictures, one after the other. "Here's a farm with lots of animals! There's a truck carrying a big load".

Town and Country can be played alone or with friends, and no reading or number skills are required.

5 variations of play, including 2 cooperative versions.

Contents: 16 cards, Game Rules

33264.name: Black & White
33264.description:
Move and jump to make a 5 in-a-row or capture all the opponents pieces in this 2-player abstract game.

Equipment:


a 5x5 board
10 reversible pieces (like in Reversi/Othello)


Each player starts with 5 pieces - one plays white the other black. The game begins with each player dropping one piece per turn on an empty cell. After that, on each turn, each player must do one of the following two actions:

Use a friendly stone to jump (orthogonally or diagonally) over an enemy piece landing on the immediate empty cell and flipping the color of the jumped piece (black turns white, and vice versa). Jumps may be multiple - i.e. a series of jumps over one enemy piece each.
Move a friendly stone to an (orthogonal or diagonal) adjacent empty cell.




The player that either makes an (orthogonal or diagonal) 5 in-a-row or captures all the opponents pieces wins.

In the online version captures (potentially multiple) are forced, and the win is by 5 in-a-row or by forcing the opponent into a stalemate. The forced moves and stalemate is not mentioned in the original rather brief rules, while the win by complete capture is not mentioned in the online version.

33265.name: Ton: The Game of Professional Darts
33265.description:
Features:
The top 250 dart players from the WDF, the BDA (men) and the BDA (women) are rated for overall skill. You get 750 players in total.
Throw-by-throw action; separate scoring systems for ton+ scoring and doubling out. Out chart included.
100 action cards drive the game engine; a match can be played in a matter of minutes.
Score sheet allows for statistical tracking as you play.
Graphical dart board included; you may call your own shots for a player rather than use the out chart. Complete rulebook included.

33266.name: Fast 40: The Game of Pro Motocross
33266.description:
Features:
Detailed lap-by-lap simulation of both Supercross & Supercross Lite. Quick qualifying process gets you into the evening heats in a few minutes.
All riders who participated in at least 3 events during last season are rated in overall skill. A large amount of unseeded riders are included to flesh out your qualifying field.
All tracks individually rated for speed and incidents.
Charts for recording lap times & cumulative times. Watch the race unfold lap-by-lap.
Drivers may crash, collide or suffer mechanical problems.

33267.name: Blade: The Game of Speed Skating
33267.description:
Features:
All skaters who competed during the 2006 season (men & women) are included. They are each graded individually for all events in which they competed.
Simple phase system allows for quick play; game is broken down into 3 skating phases: Start, mid-race and finish. Skater's performance in these stages is then combined with a base score to obtain a final time
8 different events individually charted for time
Score sheet allows for statistical tracking as you score
Each skater rated for his/her propensity to fall; injuries and collisions may also occur. Skaters may also suffer a disqualification.

33268.name: All-Arounder: Women's Gymnastics Game
33268.description:
Features:
Easy to play, an entire competition can be simulated in 1 session
All gymnasts who appeared in the 2006 season are rated in each of 4 events: Vault, Uneven Bars, Balance Beam and Floor Exercise
Individual scoring charts reflect the difficulty of each event, which when coupled with the athlete's individual rating for the event, give accurate scoring results
Point deduction system included. Athletes' scores will be adjusted due to flaws in their performance
Injury system allows for gymnasts who fall (either from an apparatus on during the floor exercise) to suffer injuries. Some may even have their careers ended by such an event!

33269.name: Limit: The Game of Pro Bass Fishing
33269.description:
Features:
The top 104 elite anglers of 2006, along with hundreds of other regional anglers, are all included and rated in individual angling skill.
All major lakes on the pro bass tour included and charted for catching frequency and weight base
Fact action cards drive the angling; obtain results for each angler quickly; "phase" system splits the fishing day into 5 segments.
Full featured events chart; experience all the oddities, fish patterns and angler behavior just as you would in real life
Optional practice session system allow anglers to get the feel of the lake; a good practice may raise their odds. Weigh-in system in which penalties may occur at weigh-in Weather system also affects the angling performance. Anglers may even catch foreign objects or suffer boating mishaps!

33270.name: Podium: The Game of Formula 1 Racing
33270.description:
Features:
Lap by lap simulation of the 2006 season
All drivers who participated in the 2006 season are included. Each is rated in overall driving ability, retirement frequency, types of retirements, pit frequency and pit crew ability.
Each circuit is individually charted to give realistic lap times.
Circuits are also rated for incident frequency
Cumulative time sheet lets you track each drivers' lap-by-lap performance; position chart lets you see at a glance how the field is progressing as the race unfolds.

33271.name: Track Shot: The Demolition Derby Game
33271.description:
Features:
Features more than 500 drivers, each rated in overall performance.
All play derived from 100 "action cards": over 100 cars to choose from.
Track conditions, pre-derby inspections, officiating style all play a part in the outcome.
Fires, the pit crew, hangups, stalls, loose car parts on the track, and many more events/components of a derby are all simulated.
Run heats, a consolation and a main event. 3 different car classes to choose from: Compact, Full-Size ('77 & newer) and Old Iron. Cars take damage just like in a real demo. Keep score as you run the events.

33272.name: Rommel: The Campaign for North Africa
33272.description:
Rommel: The Campaign for North Africa by Loren F. Sperry, self published.

1 22" x 34" map of the campaign area from El Agheila to just east of El Alamein. Turn scale is 3 turns to the month from Sept 1940 to Dec 1942. 252 1/2 counters (very thin perforated cardboard) represent the divisions, regiments, brigades and strength breakdown counters.

Game play is a simple move then fight. Supply is a bit tougher in that all units must be with 5 hexes of a supply unit, which are expended for combat.

There are some chrome rules, minefields, fortifications, recon units.

33273.name: Towers&Bridges
33273.description:
GAME SUMMARY:
Towers&Bridges is a board game for two players. It combines traditional elements of chess —such as a squared board— with original pieces and movements. The game symbolizes a battle between two feudal lords: the White Lord and the Black Lord. Each one leads an army composed by attack towers and portable bridges.
The principal aim of attack towers is to capture enemy castles. But these are surrounded by deep moats. Portable bridges are used to cover those moats. In this way, towers can cross moats; and thus, they can take castles… but only if the tower is as high as the castle. Most attack towers are initially smaller than most castles. However, they can get bigger by capturing an enemy tower. When this happens, the stages of the defeated tower are added to the winning one. So, winning attack towers become higher and higher. In the end, they may even match the highest castle: that is, the enemy lord’s one.
During the combat, both contenders may be helped by mercenaries and flying creatures. But these are jailed in strong citadels, so first of all, attack towers must free them. Once they have been liberated, mercenaries can blow enemy bridges up; and winged creatures can transport their lord by air, crossing even moats not covered by bridges.
The main purpose in the game is to trap the opponent’s feudal lord, who takes shelter in the highest castle. The player who gets this objective wins.

NOTES:
-This information was submitted by the publisher.
-The game has been published in English and Spanish.
-The game has been published as a book. Besides the rules and a game example, the book contains the cut-out board and pieces, both in duplicate.
-Towers&Bridges in English is available at: http://www.lulu.com/content/2687006
-In Spanish at: http://www.lulu.com/content/1354342

33274.name: Round Trip
33274.description: This is a game created as an individual class project , this is my first stab at designing my own game. You start off with four pieces per player, you move around the circular game board with color coordinated cards to the spaces on the board. Your objective is to get all four of your pieces back to the starting position the fastest but beware your opponents because they can land on an occupied space of yours and send you back to the beginning.

33275.name: FIFA World Cup Chess
33275.description: This game is very similar to chess. The same pieces are used and their movement is almost identical. The objective of the game is to score goals using your pieces. You must score on the goalie (king) until 3 points are acquired by one team.

33276.name: Trice
33276.description:
Trice is a game for 3 players that uses Icehouse pieces and a small, triangular gameboard. This game also uses dice. A set of 3 four-sided dice is recommended; however, if these are unavailable, the game can also be played with a pair of regular six-sided dice.

The object of the game is to occupy all of the spaces on the board that contain a specific mystic symbol. The 3 symbols are the sun, the moon, and the star. For each of these symbols, there are 5 spaces on the board that must be occupied in order to win. Two of these spaces contain only the one symbol, two are shared with one other symbol (these are called Bi-Spaces), and the final space contains all 3 symbols. (This space is the center space on the board, and it is called the Tri-Space.)

The complete rules are available at Wunderland.com.

33277.name: The Martian Gathering
33277.description:
The Martian Gathering brings two armies of Icehouse pyramids with different powers to the battlefield, where their commanders apply their leadership and magical skills through Magic cards to achieve victory.

You need Icehouse pieces for the five colours of Magic: The Gathering plus a clear set if you want to use colourless spells. The game plays fine with the basic set and fewer card colors. Each player also needs 20 Magic cards which fit their anticipated army.

Knowledge of the Magic: the Gathering rules is assumed.

Rules Link

33278.description:
The object of Martian Race is to be the first player to get all of the Martians from your family from your Home to the Government Center (to sign up for the program and get supply vouchers), the Supply Depot (to get, well, supplies), and then to the Launch Pad (to head off into space and down in history).

You will need one Icehouse-stash per player as well as two six-sided dice and a chess-board.

The complete rules are available online.
33278.name: Martian Race

33279.description: Mandala is a deceptively simple game of set collection played on a randomly-created path of Icehouse pieces. It is an adaptation of Knizia's Tutankhamen for 5 rainbow stashes of Looney Pyramids. Players place their pawns at the outside of the spiral of pyramids and collect pyramids as they move toward the center. They score points for having the majority in any particular "set" (group of 5 identical pyramids, e.g. 5 medium yellow pyramids). The player with the most points when all players (except one) have reached the center is the winner.
33279.name: Mandala

33280.description:
Edges is an abstract strategy game of placement for Icehouse-pyramids, played on the 31 edges (not squares or points) of a three by four rectangular grid representing a canal network.

Its rules are here: http://icehousegames.org/wiki/index.php?title=Edges
33280.name: Edges

33281.description:
An Icehouse game based on Conway's Game of Life. It requires one stash of pyramids per player and one chess-board. Each turn, a player places a small onto an empty space, or grows one of their existing pieces (small to medium, or medium to large). Then dead pieces are removed simultaneously from the entire board. As in Conway's Game of Life, a piece's survival depends on the number of adjacent neighbors: smalls need 1-3 neighbors, mediums need 3-5 neighbors, and larges need 5-7 neighbors to survive.

Rules Link
33281.name: Martian Life

33282.description:
Martian Frisby is an Icehouse game. It is played using nestable Icehouse game pieces, a chessboard, and dice.

Like Mrs. Frisby, you must move your nest to safety. And like a Martian, you must obey the Laws of the Pyramids.

You start with six pieces nested at one end of a chessboard. Roll the dice, and try to move all your pieces to the other end of the board. Along the way, you may nest pieces, but you may never stack them.

Rules Link
33282.name: Martian Frisby

33283.name: Igloo
33283.description:
Igloo is a turn-based Icehouse game for 2 players (or 2 teams) which can be played on any flat, stable surface. The game uses a standard set of Icehouse pieces and is set up in a similar manner, with the pieces starting out in stash zones that are not part of the playing field. Each player plays a single piece during each turn. The game ends after all pieces have been played.

Each player controls 2 sets of pyramids. However, only one set of pyramids will be worth points at the end of the game. The other set are decoys. Trying to figure out which is which, from the player's style of play and skill at bluffing, adds a level of intrigue to the game.

The complete rules are available at Wunderland.com.

33284.name: Cross Board Hockey
33284.description:
From www.crossboardlogic.com:

Cross-Board Hockey is a game of strategy similar to the popular game of soccer or hockey.

The game is played by two players each having his (or her) own team of 14 pieces. The player who is first to place one of his pieces on the net field belonging to the opposing player wins the game.

33285.name: Cosmos
33285.description:
A game involving luck, good timing and knowing the odds.

The game is a push your luck game for up to four players. Each turn a player rolls five dice and tries to advance along a linear track which marks the players score. To win, players must land on the "1200 points" space exactly.

Four dice are numbered 1-5 and 10, and the fifth is a "wild" dice, which has at least one side labeled "wild." Points are scored for rolling 5's and 10's, and also for rolling straights, three of a kind etc., in a similar manner to Yahtzee. After rolling players have the option of holding scoring dice (5's or 10's) or rolling.

However if a non-scoring combination is rolled, players lose points rolled in the current round.

The score track also features way stations, which earn the players "Opportunity points."

33286.name: Gurgitate!: the Game of Competitive Eating
33286.description:
Features:
The top pro eaters from the past 3 seasons are individually carded and rated.
Each eater is rated in each different event for which he or she participated
Fast and accurate results. The average 8-10 minute contest can be reproduced in around 30 minutes.
17 different foods each individually charted. Hot Dogs, Burgers, Meatballs, Ribs, Jalapenos, and many more foods await!
100 ready-to-print action cards included
Custom events system accounts for all of the unusual happenings in an eating competition; DQ's, penalties, and more are all here!

33287.name: Trivial Pursuit: Édition Cinéma
33287.description:
250 extra cards to be used with any Trivial Pursuit basic game.
The new cards feature 1500 questions on cinema -- mostly French pictures, but also international features.

33288.description:
TEG II is a new game from “Táctica y Estrategia de la Guerra (TEG), involving armies, ships, aircraft, and nuclear rockets. For those who never played the TEG I, as for experts strategists, the new TEG proposes a different way of playing, lots of action and rapid development.

Each player represents one of the great powers of the world: USA, USSR, CHINA, JAPAN, EUROPE WEST and EASTERN EUROPE.

At the beginning each player choose, according to their strategic thinking, several military targets, CONTROL, INTERVENTION AND NON-INTERVENTION in the various regions of the world. Each target has a value in points. All targets are placed in the TABLE OF GOALS.

After the incorporations are done comes the fighting. The fighting is between ships that occupies the same region, which can be added reinforcements brought in from neighboring regions. The battles are resolved without dice, using COMMAND OF BATTLE. Apart from the armies, ships and planes, there are other elements of exceptional strength: the “nuclear rocket” and the “special unit”. They are obtained when the player gets certain levels of war potential. At the end of the game, each player sum points of the objectives achieved. The winner is the one who got the highest score.
33288.name: T.E.G. II

33289.description:
Learn about colors and shapes while racing to be the first guest at the Queen's party!

Teach children to identify six basic colors and five basic shapes with this delightful game you can play three ways. Use just the color cards, just the shape cards, or both! Students will also learn how to follow rules and take turns.

Includes game board, 36 cards, 4 markers, directions, and teaching suggestions. Supports NAEYC standards.
33289.name: Queen Bee's Color and Shape Party!

33290.name: Het Mega Mindy Time Bordspel
33290.description:
Mega Mindy is a "world Famous" Flemish (Belgian) character, kind of wonderwoman, for the kids.
She has her own TV series, puzzles, pyama's (pajamas???) and .. her first game.

This is a racing game between you, as Mega Mindy, and a crook, a race to get to the money. By rolling the dice, you have to turn yourself into Mega Mindy, giving you special powers (faster/bigger moves) to get hold of the money first.

Good luck.

33291.description:
Expanded rules book, with additional rules beyond those included in the Advanced Rulebook (found in starter sets).

New rules include Formations, Single-Nation Armies, Special Units, Overwatch Fire, Enfilade Fire, and Grazing Fire, plus modified rules for Anti-Aircraft Fire and Defensive Fire.

New maps are also included, compatible with the maps from the 1939-1945 and later editions.

Expands:

Axis & Allies Miniatures
33291.name: Axis & Allies Miniatures Expanded Rules

33292.name: Operation
boardgameversion: English "new way to operate on the go" edition 2005
33292.description: Ostensibly a travel-version of Operation, this game has players drawing point cards and sliding the appropriate named discs through the patient using the familiar contact-buzzer. However, the pieces are not gripped and removed, but are slid from the sides of the game board (at the patiences hands/feet) into an exit slot located in the centre (the patient's abdomen). Points are counted from the cards based on which pieces could be moved without sounding the buzzer.

33293.description: Salt Lake City on Board is a Monopoly clone based on the capital of Utah. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Ouelessebougou-Utah Alliance. (Jail is replaced with The Utah Symphony and Opera. Is classical music really as bad as prison?)
33293.name: Salt Lake City on Board

33295.description:
A rip-roaring car race for 2-4 professional drivers. Ages 5 and up.

It's an easy game of car racing based in a simple roll and move mechanic. The circuit are made up with wood sticks placed in circle.

To move, the player rolls the die, if on the die appears one, two or three dots then he moves the car accordingly over one, two or three sticks. It the die shows a jerry can the player get a turbo counter but can not move. In a later turn the player can use the turbo counter to double the number of dots appearing on the die.
33295.name: Car Race

33359.description:
From Rules:

A wise man named Wei Fu had five sons who he loved dearly. He loved each in his own way, but favored his oldest most of all. In fact, he showed affection and appreciation to each son in descending order of their birth. Over time, this greatly displeased his younger sons to the point of confrontation. Being respectful to their father, the younger two sons did not accuse their father directly, but merely asked the question: "What more can I do to earn your respect?" At first the father was outraged that his younger sons would question his fidelity, but then he realized their defiance presented an opportunity.

His land had been plagued by prankster Dragon that ate his crops, scared away his workers and generally caused chaos throughout his land. He decided to put his younger sons to the test of ridding his land of this Dragon. The sons agreed, but pleaded: "Should our older brothers be denied this opportunity to prove their devotion to you?" Knowing full well his sons' intent, Wei Fu agreed to send all five sons on the quest. However, his older sons, fearful for their safety, begged for a reprieve. Acquiescing, Wei Fu decided to ease the burden by declaring: "The Dragon is the quest! However, I would still appreciate any son who brings me the finest examples of the Five Elements of Water, Wood, Fire, Earth, and Metal, which provide the very foundation of our world." With this alternative quest, he would assign the easier tasks to his older sons—or so he thought.

Weilong or "Powerful Dragon" is a simple dice game based loosely on the dice game One-O-Five and the Chinese card game Shou Ba Yi. Each player represents the role of one of Wei Fu's sons on their quest to collect the Five Elements or capture the Dragon. Each player rolls their dice and sets aside those dice showing their target number (Element). The objective is to roll all five dice of the target number before any other player. Target numbers are determined by drawing cards (Son Cards). The Son Cards also have unique abilities for the players.

Once a player has set aside all five dice of the target number or captured the Dragon (by collecting the dice 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5), the remaining players add up the total of the dice they have collected along with the penalty number at the bottom of the card and track those points. Your goal is have the lowest point total each round and for the game. The Son cards are then passed to the left and the next round begins (5 Player Game). The winner is the player who has the least amount of points after 5 rounds.
33359.name: Weilong

33360.name: Kakuro: The Board Game
33360.description:
Kakuro: The Boardgame is a one-to-four player game involving of the competitive solving of over 100 Kakuro puzzles. On a given turn, players have sixty seconds to find the solution for a particular section of the puzzle or to challenge an opponent's answer. Once the entire puzzle has been completed (or three players have "timed out" in succession), players consult the solution and score points for each correct answer. The player who filled in the most correct answers wins!

Contained within the box: Instruction book, puzzle booklet, 3D game board, clear plastic overlay, 4 dry erase markers, egg timer, small chamois (for wiping the board between games)

33361.name: Tic-Tac-Strip
33361.description: TIC-TAC-STRIP is an exciting adult game of skill and fun, which should be played by four or more. TIC-TAC-STRIP tests your drinking ability as well as your skill in maneuvering your markers in order to jeopardize your opponents. First player to move all four markers from one side of the playing board to the opposite of the board is the winner.

33362.name: Simply Manners
33362.description:
This trivia game focuses on good manners, the kind Ms. Manners can truly appreciate.

Sample Question: You have just arrived at a very formal dinner party and are about to go through the receiving line. You do not know the first person in the line, but you do know the third person. Who should you approach?

That shows this is a TOUGH game and the 60 minute playing time is a best case scenario for those of us who never graduated from finishing school.

33363.name: THC The Game
33363.description: Another treasure from adult game publisher Kheper, THC The Game is designed for people getting high on weed while playing. Players spin and move around the board, completing dares, articulating challenging tongue twisters, and thumb wrestling. The dares are determined by players before the game starts and could be taking a shot or taking off a piece of clothing.

33364.name: Mini-CassiaOpoly
33364.description: A Pride Distribution fund-raising version of Monopoly celebrating the centennials of Rupert and Burley Idaho.

33365.name: Battling Space Ships
33365.description:
Battling Space Ships is exactly what its title suggests: The players build their fleet of spaceships from miscellaneous ship parts that are dealt out at the beginning of the game. Then the filthy pirates (the players) raid the space lanes, fight the other players' ships, or maybe even carry cargo in peace.

Since this has been turned down by a couple of publishers, Tom Wham decided to self-publish it for those fans who want it now. It includes a bag full of tiles, cargo counters, six dice, asteroid bases, transit counters, rules, and a box.

33366.name: Heibelwijk
33366.description:
Game subtitle (translated): "Who needs enemies when you got neighbours?!"

Heibelwijk is a game focused on neighbourhood troubles. The occupants of 4 houses are in a constant state of nagging, annoying and badgering each other, to ultimately become the last inhabitant of the game's particular quarter of town.

As a player you have to choose which other player or players (your neighbours) you are going to pester and therefore target, and which neighbour(s) you tactically choose as your very, very best 'friend'. Following the right (social) tactics and strategies are very important in this tiny world of irritation (with an actual irritation board) and friendship. In the end it's up to you to use the commotion, beleaguer, revenge, lucky and disaster cards in the right way.

The game is best played with 4 players, but 2-player rules are included.

33367.name: Command at Sea Referee's Guide
33367.description:
From the company's website:

"The Command at Sea Referee's Guide provides everything a person needs to organize and run a multi-player "blind" wargame. By executing both sides' orders and giving both sides their contact and battle reports, a referee can create a realistic "fog of war" in a naval battle, detaching players from the near-perfect intelligence of a tabletop game. It includes procedures for blind and semi-blind games, expansions to handle non-organic assets, play aids, and game forms."

33368.name: Spiderwick Chronicles: The Fantastical Field Guide Mystery Game
33368.description:
User review: One player plays the goblins by taking one of each opponent. The other players are the Grace children. The Grace children players must get the Dumbwaiter, Key, Trunk, and Field Guide tokens in that order to move on to the second part of the game. The more turns the Grace children take gives the goblin player more opportunities to secure cage tokens to use in the second part of the game.

When the Field Guide has been secured by the Grace children, the children then must get it to Uncle Arthur Spiderwick to win the game. The goblin player wins if the Field Guide can be wrested away from the children and taken to Mulgarath the Ogre.

This game features a 3-D Spiderwick Estate as well as molded plastic goblins. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 8 and up.

33369.name: Pacific Salvo!
33369.description:
Pacific Salvo! is a stand-alone game module that may be used on its own, or in conjunction with any previously published modules of the system. Pacific Salvo! contains the basic Salvo! game rules (in the form of the postcard game which includes ten ships, a sheet for 48 ships from World War II Pacific fleets, and a rules folder containing optional rules, scenarios, and Ship Roster. (From the intro to the game.)

Expands:

Salvo!
Advanced Salvo! 1939-1941

33370.description: Field of Honour is a simple game depicting a medieval jousting contest. The standard game is played by two players: each plays a single knight. You may thus play the standard game (knight vs. knight), or stage a more elaborate tournament with most any number of players in a single-elimination competition. (From the intro to the game in Panzer Digest #2.)
33370.name: Field of Honour: Jousting

33371.description: Swordfish at Taranto is a solitaire game depicting the British air assault on the Italian port of Taranto in November 1940. It is a "narrative experience" game, where players set up the game and watch the story unfold before them. The object of the game is for the player--playing the British--to gain as many victory points as possible. (From the intro to the game in Panzer Digest #2.)
33371.name: Swordfish at Taranto

33372.description: The Evacuation of Königsberg is a 2-player game simulating the Russian assault on the East Prussian city of Königsberg and the German defense and evacuation of the city and surrounding areas in early 1945. While the eventual fall of the city is a foregone conclusion, the goal of the German player is to accumulate victory points by evacuating civilians and military personnel before the fall. The goal of the Russian player is to prevent this by capturing the city as soon as possible. (From the intro to the game in Panzer Digest #2.)
33372.name: The Evacuation of Königsberg

33373.name: The 70's: A Game for Your Generation
boardgamepublisher: Late for the Sky Production Company
33373.description: The 70's is a Monopoly based on the 1970's. Squares are based on historical and cultural trends of the day.

33375.description: Waukesha County On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the county in Wisconsin. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Unplanned Pregnancy Connection Inc and Healthy Families of Waukesha County Inc.
33375.name: Waukesha County On Board

33376.description: Saskatoon On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Saskatchewan, Canada. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Huskies Football.
33376.name: Saskatoon On Board

33377.name: Schweizer Sport Quiz
33377.description:
This is a typical trivia game that focuses on sports questions.

There are 7 categories:
(most are focused on the Swiss sports scene)
- Cycling
- Soccer
- Athleticism
- Alpine Sports
- Olympics
- International Sport

You try to move your pawn to the center of the map by answering the questions right. First one to come there wins.
The questions go back to 1924 and up to events in 1992.

33378.name: Viikinkiseikkailu
33378.description:
Another game in Peliko's series of games illustrated by Mauri Kunnas.

Very simple spin-and-move fare: Move your ship to the next square matching the color shown on the spinner. The first player to reach the harbor wins. If you land on a special square and lose the challenge there, you have to retreat a few steps.

33379.description:
A simple game on a 3x3 grid, where each side has 3 chess pawns. The objective is to get a pawn to the other side of the board, or leave the opponent unable to move. Normal chess rules apply except that the pawns are not allowed a double move from their starting position.

Not really intended as a two-player game, it was designed to demonstrate an artificial intelligence learning technique by using beads in matchboxes. (Old enough to remember matchboxes?) Twenty-four matchboxes were used to represent the possible moves. Essentially, there were two phases. The first phase was to "teach" the matchbox computer to play the game, then a second phase allowed the matchbox computer to play other opponents. The learning speed depended on the skill of the opponent in the teaching phase.

There are variants in which taking the opponent's piece is mandatory ("Dawson's chess") and ones that use larger boards.

Martin Gardner first published this in his Mathematical Games column in March 1962, and subsequently in his book, "The Unexpected Hanging".
33379.name: Hexapawn

33380.name: Business India
33380.description:
The follwing has been taken directly from the box (spelling errors have been preserved):

Business India A Trade Game

A game of Buying and Selling Banking Mortaging etc.

Great entertainment for whole family

Expand your BUSINESS with Tranportation

PROVE YOURSELF AS A RICHER OF ALL

From the Rulebook (written in English and Hindi):

BRIEF IDEA OF THE GAME

The object of the game is to learn business or trade buying, and selling of properties so that one becomes the welthiest player by same method and honoured as BUSINESS. Player come across the game ups and down falls sometimes he gets reward and some times he has to pay penalties etc. By arriving at CHANCE OR COMMUNITY CHEST. Right from beginning of the game till the end, it gives to the players excitement, pleasure and ammusement. When a player taken and on a space not already owned, he may buy it from the Bank, otherwise he has to pay rent to the owner of that site, Rents are greatly increased by erection of house and hotels. During Financial difficulties, properties can be mortgaged to the Bank.

M.R.P. Incl. of all Taxes: Rs. 135/-

Business India is very similar to Monopoly.

33381.name: Den ofrivillige spelaren
33381.description: Every player begins with 1 million. The goal is to have as much money before the time (24 "in game" hour) is out. In the game there is 4 small games you can bet money at - poker, horses, roulette and keno (a sort of lotto).

33382.name: Femetta
33382.description: Femetta, a cardgame with a board, where you should collect as many card with the same number as possible, or have as many cards with the same colour as you could. Every third round the points become higher.

33383.description:
WobBally is three games in one and consists of a Tower of 98 very unstable balls. Test your skills and patience by tapping the balls into the Tower one by one! The player who causes the Tower to collapse is out of the game.

The tower is a series of layers of plastic balls, separated by ring plates. The tower is protected by a clear plastic cylinder with an indicator built into the top to show when the tower has been placed on a level surface. The protecting cylinder is removed and the whole thing becomes distinctly unstable. The centre of the tower is hollow and sticks provided are used to tap balls from the tower ring into the centre well, where they fall to the bottom and roll out of an aperture in the base.

Roll the dice to see what color ball you have to knock out, and from what level. Using the cue stick, carefully try to remove it - but watch out! The player who makes the WobBally tower collapse is out of the game! Dramatic sways and increasing instability keeps the suspense and action growing. The winner is the last player left after all the other players have made the balls spill.

The rules give 3 ways to play. Can be played solitaire.
33383.name: WobBally
boardgamepodcastepisode: Spiele-Podcast Nr. 74: WobBally - Der lustige Wackelkugelturm (W&L Verlag)

33384.name: Grand Slam
33384.description: Grand Slam by the Stoll Edwards Company is a card game that can be played by from 2 to 6 players. At the beginning of each hand trumps are selected by cutting the cards. The suits of this game are Stars, Circles, Diamonds and Squares. and each suit has cards numbered from 1 to 13. After the deal the dealer plays a card to the center of the table and each player follows in turn either playing a card of that suit or a trump card or a card of another suit. Highest card in the suit played wins the trick unless a trump is played and then the highest trump card wins the trick. In this game the first 6 tricks are called 'Par' which is similar to the first 6 tricks in Bridge being called 'Book' and do not score. All tricks above 'Par" score 5 points each, A Small Slam (winning 12 tricks scores an additional 50 points while a Grand Slam scores and additional 100 points. Also each #6 card won adds 5 points, each #10 card won adds 10 points and each #13 card won adds 15 points to your total. Play is to some predetermined number like 500 or 1000 points.

33386.name: Le Lys et la Cocarde
33386.description:
Le Lys et la Cocarde is a game about the French Revolution.
Two to six players try to survive the Revolution traveling the gameboard from 1789 to 1799.
110 cards, 2 ten sided dice.

33387.description:
This game is official release, based on comics series: Thorgal (Rosinski/Van Hamme). Graphics are taken from comics, and the whole game is well-kept in original Thorgals climate.

Mechanic:
Each player sends heroes to execute quests. This give him victory points. He who gains a definite number of points - wins. Players may also send heroes and monsters to disturb other players heroes as they try to do their quests.

In the game are these types of cards:
1. Missions - each has level of difficulty, and adds special conditions.
2. Heroes - they are send to finish quests or disturb enemy heroes.
3. Monsters - they can only disturb. Cannot finish quests.
4. Equipment - can be used by heroes.
5. Spells - can by uses only by heroes with spellcasting ability.
6. Special event cards (called in game: ruse) - many different types, and different effects.

Each card can be used as normal card, or can be thrown aside when battle occurs. Thrown cards give bonuses to Attack and Defence.
33387.name: Thorgal Kolekcjonerska Gra Karciana

33388.name: Home Team Baseball Game
33388.description: Caption on the box says, "Play by the rules of big league baseball." A 1964 baseball simulation game for 2 players. The game is played on a two level "board." The upper level has the baseball diamond and the lower level has 2 dugouts. The game also comes with spinner. Instructions are on the inside of the lid.

33389.description:
Türkenkrieg: The Russo-Austro Turkish War, Balkan Theatre 1737-39
Volume V in the Lace Wars series

TK is a two-player game: Imperial Austria against the Ottoman Empire. The Turks have three provincial armies, composed of a mix of infantry and cavalry, and the Sultan's own army of heavy cavalry, janissaries, and artillery. They can also call upon Wallachian and Tatar allies. The Imperials have their core Habsburg-Austrian army, plus contingents from the Holy Roman Empire, and elements from the personal armies of Saxony, Bavaria, and even Modena. They also have the irregular forces of the Military Border.

Both sides are evenly matched - weakened by war but still dwarfing the forces of their neighbors. The Imperials begin as the aggressors, but will have to play cannily to avoid surrendering the initiative to the Ottomans. Playing for Prestige (like the other games in the series), your goals are modest, but can add up to significant gains that may influence the outcome of the peace talks. The peace process, more or less out of your hands, is the mechanism by which the game ends.

Map scale is 8.5 miles per hex. Unit scale is battalion/regimental. Units are rated for Effectiveness and Movement; raw strength is factored into Effectiveness.

Turns are equivalent to three weeks - 16 turns per year. Each turn is broken down into several phases - supply, operations, admin, etc. There are scenarios for each year of active operations - three in all - and a Campaign Game.

A few key concepts include Initiative and Operational Preparedness, Campaign Plans, Prestige, and Auxiliaries. This game uses the 3rd edition of the Lace Wars rules, amended to 3.1.

The heart of the game is the Operations Phase, where the players move their formations, lay siege to fortresses and engage in battle. The player with the initiative can dictate the pace of the game, but since initiative is based on operational preparedness, it can pass to another side, perhaps at an inconvenient time.

Auxiliary counters represent support troops and irregulars who had a major impact on operations, but cannot be adequately represented as traditional game units. Instead, a player might have a pontooneer auxiliary that he can play onto a stack to help it cross a major river, or a converged grenadier auxiliary that provides a morale bonus in combat. Because of the scale, many combat elements can be used either as units or as Auxiliaries.
[Playing cards could have been used instead of counters, but there are production issues involved, and besides, some of the auxiliaries' functions are hard to indicate with cards. In essence, however, auxiliaries are that kind of game asset, not "pawns" like the combat units.]

Leaders have an important role to play, as befitting an era where personal command was critical. They are rated for skill or effectiveness, personality, and influence (i.e. the chance they have of retaining command despite their incompetence).

The supply system incorporates lines of communication, the strategic placement of depots, foraging, and attrition. River and canal movement has been taken into account and will prove as critical to success as the use of rail lines in games that cover more modern periods.

The combat system has a tactical feel - while not a full sub-system with battlefield maps, it addresses the key issues of frontage, reserves, and supports, as well as firepower and morale. Winning a battle will bring you the acclaim of your noble peers, but may not gain you any strategic advantage; losing a battle can be catastrophic.

Components

1) Eight 12x18 inch full colour maps representing the Danube Basin and the surrounding lands, from the Adriatic to the Black Sea, and from central Hungary to Bulgaria.

2) 1080 counters representing the forces of Austria, Saxony, Bavaria, Hesse, Cologne and other Holy Roman Empire states, Modena, the Sultan's Army, the Ottoman provincial commands of Bosnia, Rumelia, and Silistria, the Wallachians, and the Crimean Tatars.

3) A set of charts and tables, plus several 11x17 inch display cards.

4) A series rulebook - 3rd Edition (3.1) - called the King's Regulations and Orders (KR&Os), a game-exclusive rulebook, scenario & OOB information, and an historical commentary.
33389.name: Türkenkrieg (1737-1739)

33390.name: Handbook of American Indian Games
33390.description: This 288-page trade paperback is an very well-researched overview of the sports and games of American Indians. 150 different activities are covered, but of particular importance to board gamers are the chapters on guessing games and ceremonial games. Most of these are easily recognized as what we now consider party games.

33391.name: Start Business
33391.description: Start Business is about the process of starting a business. Players open shops in different parts of the city of Kiev and then construct roads so that they can place additional shops. The shops bring income which can be used to buy components (in the form of building blocks) that are used to complete a mission, such as build a school or church. The first player to fulfill their mission wins.

33392.name: Wordbattle
33392.description:
This is a word game that can be played with any number of players.

It is composed of three dice with letters and one die with numbers - there are four letters or numbers with their own color on each side of the die.

Once the dice are rolled, in the allotted time (3 minutes), players try to make a word with the twelve visible letters . Points are given with each letter of the word receiving the value of its like-colored number. In addition to basic 3-6 letter words, the scorecard rewards bonuses if the player can come up with an animal, a name of a town, a word that is 7+ letters, and a word that is composed solely of one color.

A game lasts eight rolls of the dice, with one category on the scorecard being completed with each roll. The player with the highest score at the end wins.

33393.name: Rich Man, Poor Man, Beggarman, Thief
33393.description:
Starting as "beggarmen," players circle the board working their way up the ladder of success. Beggars can get "charity" from non-beggars, rich men and poor men collect regular incomes, and thieves can steal from rich and poor alike. There's fast money to be made through investments and playing the horses, and faster money through gambling on a dice throw--but developing real estate is safer. The many options and sudden changes of fortune make this an exciting, free-wheeling game.

(Description from Nov. 1985 issue of GAMES Magazine, p. 45)

33394.name: Plasma Duel
33394.description:
Use warriors, dragons, catapults and cards to conquer and destroy opponent and win Plasma Duel.

This is a miniatures game included with Mega Bloks' Plasma Dragons construction toy line (a Canadian LEGO compatible toy). Players' soldiers pair off and fight using random draws from pre-constructed decks, plus players can use rubberband-powered catapults to try to hit enemy soldiers without resorting to hand-to-hand combat. Players can include dragons in their armies, which cost more but tend to have more powerful combat draws. The loser of each battle loses a piece, until all pieces from one army have been eliminated. Last man standing wins!

33395.description:
(from Clash of Arms:)

Centered in the Scottish Wars of Independence, William Wallace, the Brave Heart of legend, faces the real task of defeating the English on the medieval battlefield.

His greatest victory; Stirling Bridge, 11 September 1297, pits him and the Scottish rebels against the larger, professional English army of the Earl of Surrey. Luring the English across the bridge, Wallace and Moray strike hard when only half the English had crossed. Three scenarios explore the historical situation.

His greatest defeat; Falkirk, 22 July 1298, once again pits Wallace, now the Guardian of Scotland, against the English, led by Edward I (Longshenks) himself. Falkirk would be a great English victory but at the cost of much blood...and would herald the age of the long bow in English history.

Based on the Baron's War system, Wallace's War focuses on the command and weaponry of the medieval battlefield.



(from the Designer:)Wallace's War is the second game in the medieval game series (the other is Barons' War) and this time focuses on William Wallace and his two major battles, Stirling Bridge and Falkirk. The system has been cleaned up considerably by Frank Hastege (who did yeoman's work on the rules). The goal of the series is to create a platform on which to re-create the medieval battlefield. The system is meant to reflect the problems that leaders of the time had. One special focus is the control one has on the battlefield. Once the battle started the leader had the problem of how to change his initial plan if things started to go poorly.
33395.name: Wallace's War

33396.name: Cuckoo, A Society Game
33396.description:
A card game from the J.H. Singer Company of New York , copyrighted 1891. Each player is provided with a card which he or she must place in front of themselves on the table in plain view of all, he or she is also provided with 9 counters. The players throw a die in turn and the color thrown must be covered on the card by a counter. The die is six-sided die with 2 sides green, 2 sides red, 1 side white and 1 side black. If "black" is thrown the players must take a counter off of his/her card, if he should have none to take he/she loses the next turn.

The player who first succeeds in covering all of the spaces on his/her card calls out CUCKOO and wins the game.

33397.name: Princess & The Pea
33397.description: A children's game for ages 5 and up. From the publisher's catalog: "Just like Hans Christian Anderson's beloved fairy tale The Princess and the Pea the prince is searching for a real princess. In this game, you move your bed along the board, adding mattresses to it as you go. To win, you need to build the highest bed and reach the special "crown" space! Are you the real princess?"

33398.name: En-Ar-Co Automobile Tour
33398.description:
Actually a spin and move game for from 1 to 4 players. The game En-Ar-Co Automobile Tour was developed by EN-AR-CO Brands of Scientific Refining and produced by the National Refining Company in 1919. Each player spins to see who will go first. Players then spin in rotation, each player taking one turn. You then move a number of circles equal to the number that you spun. If the dial of the spinner lands exactly on a line you take another turn. If more than one auto lands on a circle they both stay there. Some circles give players one or more extra spins while at some other points you must go back a certain number of circles. If a player lands on the last circle located at number 45 before entering the large final circle, he must spin a #1 in order to win the game.

See Also:

En-Ar-Co Auto Game A similar 1925 game also issued by En-Ar-Co, with a different track.

33399.name: Fast Car
33399.description:
"Enjoy the thrills and action of stock car racing in this exciting board game. Race on either of the 2 tracks with as many as 8 racers"

Roll & move racer with a NASCAR flavor but without a NASCAR license. Board is double-sided with a standard oval track on one side and a road course on the other.

Roll & move mechanic is modified by "Lap Cards" and "Track Cards." Track cards [denoted by icons on the board] present move bonuses or penalties.

Drawn as a driver completes a lap, Lap Cards give drivers various numbers of points, instruct drivers whether or not to pit, or present drivers the opportunity to send an opponent to the pits.

33400.name: Gee Wiz Racing Game
33400.description:
This game features a fly wheel and a starting grid for 6 horses. From the rules: Before running the race be certain that all horses are lined up evenly at the barrier (starting point) and that all the flags at the opposite end of the track are lowered. To operate, hook loop in string over the pin in the shaft and wind by turning the fly wheel away from you 5 or 6 times. Then hold the game down with one hand and give a vigorous pull toward you. This should keep the fly wheel spinning with enough power to carry all of the horses the complete length of the track to the point where the flags go up. As the horses finish the flags rise, for instance if the white flag goes up then the white horse has won the race and the flags go up in corresponding sequence as the horses all "come in". To line up the horses for the next race simply pass the string in front of the horses and draw them back to the start line. All horses have an equal chance of winning the race because once the race starts no one can have control of the action of the horses.

The rules then go on to say that in some instances dirt or dust can retard the forward motion of a horse. To avoid this, the grooves in the tracks should be kept clean by occasional use of a soft cloth. Also a drop of lubricating oil on the bearing at each end of the fly wheel now and then is advisable and that GEE-WHIZ should be played on an even and level surface.

33402.description:
This is another charming key-chain game from Haba. An unusual feature of this range of games is that the name of the game that appears on the packaging (and only the back of the packaging) is different from the name of the game in the rulebook. So while this game might be labeled as Zwerge, the rules call it Schneewitten und die sieben Zwerge (Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs).

Described as a cheeky die game for 2 dwarfs aged 4-99, the authors are Wolfgang Dirscherl (who has designed several games in this series) and Markus Nikisch. The illustrations are by Stefan Fischer.

You get 7 wooden dwarfs in 3 colours (divided 3-2-2), and a special die with spots of the 3 colours (the colour with 3 dwarfs is repeated), a side showing Snow White and a side showing the wicked witch. Players take turns rolling the die. If the die shows a coloured spot, the player takes a dwarf of that colour from the centre, or from the other player if there aren't any more of that colour in the centre. If the die shows Snow White, the player gets to take a dwarf of any colour from the centre or the other player.
